metadata.title: CVE-2020-25637 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - negligible
metadata.description:
A double free memory issue was found to occur in the libvirt API, inversions before 6.8.0, responsible for requesting information about networkinterfaces of a running QEMU domain. This flaw affects the polkit accesscontrol driver. Specifically, clients connecting to the read-write socketwith limited ACL permissions could use this flaw to crash the libvirtdaemon, resulting in a denial of service, or potentially escalate theirprivileges on the system. The highest threat from this vulnerability is todata confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-clients - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-clients-qemu - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-system - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-l10n - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-login-shell - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-sanlock - 6.8.0-1
libvirt-wireshark - 6.8.0-1
libvirt0 - 6.8.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1').
